growPlans.name: Mixed Greens
growPlans.description: A grow plan suited for growing any variety of herbs and leafy greens you want. Basil, cilantro, lettuce, swiss chard, throw it all in!

phases.name: Seedling
phases.description: Seedling phase, from planting seeds until first true leaves appear. The Bitponics device isn't necessary for this phase since seedlings do fine with just plain tap water, and most seed-starting systems are too small for the water sensors anyway.

growSystem.name: Egg-carton seed starter
growSystem.description: Seed-starting system made with a plastic egg carton. For full directions on how to make one, go here: http://bitponics.com/guides/water-culture-system. And this system doesn't have room for pH and EC sensors, but you won't need them anyway since in the seed-starting phase you just use plain tap water. So just put the caps on those sensors, unplug them and store them aside until you get to the next phase.

phaseEndActions.description: Transplant seedlings into the grow bed

states.message: Flush and refill reservoir. Discard any solution in the reservoir, rinse the entire system with water. Then refill the reservoir to capacity with water. Mix in ¼ cup Grow nutrient, then ¼ cup Bloom nutrient, then ¼ cup Micro nutrient.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

phases.name: Vegetative
phases.description: Vegetative phase. Bring in any existing plants or seedlings with their first pair of true leaves.

states.message: Flush and refill reservoir. Discard any solution in the reservoir, rinse the entire system with water. Then refill the reservoir to capacity with water. Mix in ¼ cup Grow nutrient, then ¼ cup Bloom nutrient, then ¼ cup Micro nutrient.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

growPlans.name: Tomato
growPlans.description: Growing indeterminate organic tomatoes (Redfield Beauty OG) for year round fruiting. Growing in a 3’x3’ grow bed filled with 4" of hydroton.

phases.name: Seedling
phases.description: Seedling phase, from planting seeds until first true leaves appear. The Bitponics device isn't necessary for this phase since seedlings do fine with just plain tap water, and most seed-starting systems are too small for the water sensors anyway.

And this system doesn't have room for pH and EC sensors, but you won't need them anyway since in the seed-starting phase you just use plain tap water. So just put the caps on those sensors, unplug them and store them aside until you get to the next phase.

phases.name: Vegetative
phases.description: Vegetative phase. Bring in any existing plants or seedlings with their first pair of true leaves.

states.message: Flush and refill reservoir. Discard any solution in the reservoir, rinse the entire system with water. Then refill the reservoir to capacity with water. Mix in ¼ cup Grow nutrient, then ¼ cup Bloom nutrient, then ¼ cup Micro nutrient.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

phases.name: Blooming
phases.description: Open-ended blooming phase. After about 7 days, you should begin to see blossoms.

actions.description: Pollinate any new blossoms. Use a small paintbrush or cotton swab brush to distribute pollen between flowers.

states.message: Flush and refill reservoir. Discard any solution in the reservoir, rinse the entire system with water. Then refill the reservoir to capacity with water. Mix in ¼ cup Grow nutrient, then ¼ cup Bloom nutrient, then ¼ cup Micro nutrient.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

phases.name: Fruiting
phases.description: Fruiting phase. Continue to pollinate blossoms and harvest fruit when fully ripened (red).

states.message: Flush and refill reservoir. Discard any solution in the reservoir, rinse the entire system with water. Then refill the reservoir to capacity with water. Mix in ¼ cup Grow nutrient, then ¼ cup Bloom nutrient, then ¼ cup Micro nutrient.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

growPlans.name: Peppers
growPlans.description: A Grow plan suited for a variety of hot or sweet peppers

phases.name: Seedling
phases.description: Seedling phase, from planting seeds until first true leaves appear. The Bitponics device isn't necessary for this phase since seedlings do fine with just plain tap water, and most seed-starting systems are too small for the water sensors anyway.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

phases.name: Vegetative
phases.description: Vegetative phase. Bring in any existing plants or seedlings with their first pair of true leaves.

growPlans.name: Peppers
growPlans.description: A Grow plan suited for a variety of hot or sweet peppers

phases.name: Seedling
phases.description: Seedling phase, from planting seeds until first true leaves appear. The Bitponics device isn't necessary for this phase since seedlings do fine with just plain tap water, and most seed-starting systems are too small for the water sensors anyway.

phases.name: Vegetative
phases.description: Vegetative phase. Bring in any existing plants or seedlings with their first pair of true leaves.

growPlans.name: Wall of Mixed Greens
growPlans.description: When you want a wall you can eat buffet. Growing close to 100 plants, mix and match whatever kind of herbs & lettuces & greens you want to grow. This involves putting together your own system based on wool pocket planters.

phases.name: Seedling
phases.description: Seedling phase, from planting seeds until first true leaves appear. The Bitponics device isn't necessary for this phase since seedlings do fine with just plain tap water, and most seed-starting systems are too small for the water sensors anyway. Use the seed-starting plugs from General Hydroponics Rapid Rooter or Flora Root.

phaseEndActions.description: Transplant seedlings into the grow bed

states.message: Check water level in seed tray. Make sure there's a thin layer at the bottom of the tray to last the seedlings through the day.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

phases.name: Vegetative
phases.description: Open-ended vegetative phase. Bring in any existing plants or seedlings with their first pair of true leaves. Continually harvest leaves whenever you want; the plants should just continue to grow back.

states.message: Check reservoir level and top off if level has dipped more than an inch or so.

Turn off water pump. Discard all solution in the reservoir. Then refill the reservoir with water, leaving 1" of room from the top. Mix in ½ cup FloraGro Grow nutrient and ½ cup FloraGro Bloom nutrient. Finally, resume water pump cycle.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

growPlans.name: Island of Microgreens
growPlans.description: A grow plan designed for Bitponics' custom microgreens drawer island. Continuous harvests of any edible microgreens you want to grow.

phases.name: Forever
phases.description: This garden runs a single, continuous phase indefinitely. Designed for optimal growth of seedlings.

growSystem.name: Bitponics Microgreens Kitchen Island
growSystem.description: A beautiful wooden 4'x2' kitchen island with a butcher-block countertop and 8 pull-out drawers of microgreen trays, with built-in LED lighting for each drawer.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

growPlans.name: Glass Curtain
growPlans.description: A grow plan for Bitponics' PSFK window exhibit, featuring 25 glass vessels hung across a 6'x10' window.

phases.name: Seedling
phases.description: Seedling phase, from planting seeds until first true leaves appear. The Bitponics device isn't necessary for this phase since seedlings do fine with just plain tap water, and most seed-starting systems are too small for the water sensors anyway. This phase is for the "All-Purpose" grow plan so its sensor ranges aren't optimal for any specific plant, but instead describe a range that should be adequate for most plants.
phases.phaseEndDescription: This phase is over once the seedlings start growing their first true leaves.

phaseEndActions.description: Transplant seedlings into the grow bed

states.message: Check water level in seed tray. Make sure there's a thin layer at the bottom of the tray to last the seedlings through the day.

actions.description: Light cycle, with lights on between 6am and 10pm.

phases.name: Vegetative
phases.description: Open-ended vegetative phase. Bring in any existing plants or seedlings with their first pair of true leaves.

growSystem.description: The system provided to our Kickstarter backers.

And this system doesn't have room for pH and EC sensors, but you won't need them anyway since in the seed-starting phase you just use plain tap water. So just put the caps on those sensors, unplug them and store them aside until you get to the next phase.

growSystems.name: Bitponics Water Culture System
growSystems.description: The system provided to our Kickstarter backers.

growSystems.name: Bitponics Glass Curtain
growSystems.description: Columns of plants grown in custom glass vessels, hung on steel wires extending from floor to ceiling. Originally designed for PSFK's "Future of Home Living" exhibit in the summer of 2013.

growSystems.name: Bitponics Microgreens Kitchen Island
growSystems.description: A beautiful wooden 4'x2' kitchen island with a butcher-block countertop and 8 pull-out drawers of microgreen trays, with built-in LED lighting for each drawer.

lightFixtures.name: Any fixture that takes 1 standard CFL bulb.

growPlanDefault.name: All-Purpose
growPlanDefault.description: A generic grow plan suitable for running a garden with a wide variety of plants. It won't get you optimum yields for everything, but it's a good starting point while you learn about the specific needs of your plants.
